title: World Cup: Worries About Next Week And Controversy Over 2022
teaser: Lots of work remains before the World Cup begins on June 12 in Brazil. Meantime, there are bribe allegations against 2022 host Qatar.
contentencoded:
The World Cup begins on June 12 and lots of work remains. Meantime, a British paper has reported that a Qatari soccer official paid bribes in exchange for votes to host the World Cup in 2022.

Here & Now sports analyst Mike Pesca discusses the latest on these stories with host Jeremy Hobson.

Guest

  • Mike Pesca, Here & Now sports analyst and host of Slate’s The Gist podcast. He tweets @pescami.
